Intervention: Participants receive colloidal injection of Tc-99m of sulfur technetium and lymphoscintigraphy according to clinical practice. Prior to surgery, participants also receive a subdermal green indocyanin solution close to the tumor or in the subareolar region of the breast skin.
Eligibility: Participants with a confirmed diagnosis of breast cancer at clinical stage 1 or 2
Participants undergoing breast cancer surgery with lumpectomy or mastectomy
Participants with a planned axillary sentinel ganglia biopsy procedure
Participants with clinically positive lymph nodes
Participants with previous breast cancer surgery in the breast index
Participants who have undergone bilateral breast surgery
Results: Proportion of sentinel lymph nodes (NSLs) marked by both methods

Whether A is the number of Tc-positive and ICG-positive (SN) sentinel nodes detected, B is the number of Tc-positive and ICG-negative SNs detected, and C is the number of Tc-positive and ICG-positive SNs detected. Therefore, the total number (N) of SNs detected is N = (A + B + C); the proportion of SNs detected by the Tc method (PTc) is (A + B)/N; and the proportion of SNs detected by the ICG method (PICG) is (A + C)/N. Differences in the proportions of LSNs reported will be compared with a 95% confidence interval.
Title of the arm/group: Diagnostic (Indocyanine Green, radiotracer marked 99mTc)
In addition, participants receive a subdermal green indocyanin solution close to the tumour or in the subareolar region of the breast skin prior to surgery.
Unit of measurement: proportion of nodes Proportion of SN (PTc) detected by method Tc: 0.86
Proportion of SN (PICG) detected by the ICG method: 0.95
